text:
Hiya anyone,
I am trying to use the events v3 api to fetch data on a contacts page views and form submissions. When I request with the e_visitied_page event its fine, however when I use the e_form_submission_v2 event I get the 'event-detail-read' scope is missing. The docs only say it needs the BI scope and I cannot find any reference to the event-detail-read scope other than a dead end forum post.

Any help greatly appreciated : )
Hello, I am completely new to the HubSpot api. Is it possible to get all blogs and create a row inside a table with the title of the blog? by using the API?

I'm trying to test the site search API in HubSpot docs but I'm getting an error saying I need to add my portalId — but I don't see a place to add it: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/cms/site-search>
can anyone please point me in the right direction?
I ended up doing a CURL request instead
yeah that's smart but might be a little more complex than you need

<@U051U23LBKP> I now you can create a row inside a table using the HubSpot API but just wanted to mentioned that base on the documentation the Blog API still in beta. I don't know if they haven't updated the Blog API, are you trying to get all the blog posts? If so I would send a request to the Blog API get all the blog posts data that you want, then make another request to the HubDB API to create the table row with the data that you got . I added both docs links, I will see if I can make a basic demo for you in a bit:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/cms/hubdb>
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/cms/blog-post>
Gotcha will keep that in mind! Thank you

Good morning again. I am looking through the docs of creating a note via the api and I cant seem to figure out what association category and association Id to select. Nor can I seem to find the defined list. Anyone have resources to help me solve this problem? (solved)
Has anyone had the problem of creating a note or any sort of engagement in HubSpot api and it works, but when done in you application it doesn't?
Using the *`/marketing/v3/forms/`* forms endpoing you could get all the forms and find the name you are looking for.

Hello Everyone, using the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/conversations/conversations|Conversations inbox and messages APIs (BETA)>.How can I list all the conversations that a contact has had (conversations, inbox), that I can filter by `associatedContactId` and bring both open and closed status.

Hello.

Has anyone had any luck searching the Deals object - propertiesWithHistory; HubSpot_owner_id using a filter by timestamp?

I’m trying to filter just a subset of the owner history for deals based on the value returned in the history array.

here’s an example of the output using this API call:/v3/objects/deals?propertiesWithHistory=HubSpot_owner_id

```{
    "results": [
        {
            "id": "788140795",
            "properties": {
                "amount": "10000",
                "closedate": "2022-06-26T22:46:10.281Z",
                "createdate": "2022-05-22T23:19:44.803Z",
                "dealname": "EXAMPLE DEAL",
                "dealstage": "60283811",
                "hs_lastmodifieddate": "2023-05-23T05:15:26.191Z",
                "hs_object_id": "788140795",
                "pipeline": "71293456"
            },
            "propertiesWithHistory": {
                "HubSpot_owner_id": [
                    {
                        "value": "47181635",
                        "timestamp": "2022-11-18T00:10:20.090Z",```
I’m trying to filter using the property timestamp above, but am not sure how to write the propertyName filter.

I don’t think what you want to do is possible. filterGroups/filters are not available for GET requests as they don’t include a request body, and /deals/search endpoint does not allow for a propertiesWithHistory to be specified.

You’ll likely have to filter them as desired after the fact…
What is the HubSpot Base URL to be used, in other words is there a difference between `<https://api.HubSpot.com>` and `<https://api.hubapi.com/>`?
